intro: Hieracium ponojense, commonly known as the Ponojense hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Hieracium ponojense is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cooler, moist conditions.
